item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 25, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ask HN: What are you working on? (May 2025) (86 points | 256 comments)
2. Plwm – An X11 window manager written in Prolog (121 points | 24 comments)
3. Path to a free self-taught education in Computer Science (139 points | 67 comments)
4. Lottie is an open format for animated vector graphics (231 points | 99 comments)

6. Lisping at JPL (2002) (91 points | 19 comments)
7. Claude 4 System Card (516 points | 205 comments)
8. Koog, a Kotlin-based framework to build and run Al agents in idiomatic Kotlin (33 points | 4 comments)

10. Design Pressure: The Invisible Hand That Shapes Your Code (122 points | 32 comments)
11. Show HN: DaedalOS – Desktop Environment in the Browser (97 points | 19 comments)
12. Denmark to raise retirement age to 70 (240 points | 579 comments)
13. CAPTCHAs are over (in ticketing) (95 points | 122 comments)

20. 'Strange metals' point to a whole new way to understand electricity (91 points | 28 comments)
21. Can a corporation be pardoned? (43 points | 71 comments)
22. Show HN: SVG Animation Software (160 points | 74 comments)

26. Now you can watch the Internet Archive preserve documents in real time (105 points | 10 comments)
27. Programming on 34 Keys (2022) (51 points | 74 comments)

29. We broke down that weird 9-minute Sam Altman and Jony Ive video (4 points | discuss)
30. Show HN: AI Baby Monitor – local Video-LLM that beeps when safety rules break (72 points | 56 comments)
